intro: Sphenogyne sericea, commonly known as the silky sphenogyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sphenogyne sericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
